I tried Cloud Print from my Chromebook through my PC's printer and it worked fine, though given the balky nature of router and wifi printer connections, I wouldn't bet my life on it working from afar.There are also versions of the Chromebook available to academic institutions and businesses at monthly service pricing, which includes an administrative console software package. Presumably the console feature will allow a not particularly techie central administrator to enable or disable features and logins remotely for their Chromebook users. Institutions may also be interested in PC desktop software emulators being readied for Chrome OS, giving you the ability to use PC software remotely via a Chrome browser window.The bottom line is that if you're using the Web for virtually everything already, have regular contact with good wifi and wireless data connections and you're looking to leave PCs behind (or never wanted one in the first place), a Chromebook may be right for you. You may think that you'll use it as a backup device, relying on your PC or Mac to do your everyday "heavy lifting." And if you're using heavy duty software like professional video and photo editors, high-power document layouts and fonts or gotta-have-the-software services like Skype, then that may be the case. But if my own experience and the experience of other early Chrome OS adapters is any guide, you'll be finding every excuse you can to make your Chromebook your "plan A" machine. Its fast startup, near-zero virus hassles, ease of use, light form factor, amazing battery life and ease of use make it a real pleasure to use for all but the most software-heavy applications. Key offline apps for productivity are coming soon, as are better device interfaces, and Chrome OS in general is forcing Web apps to get better. Chromebooks are ready for a Web that's getting better and more powerful by the day. Best of all, Chromebooks are pretty future-proof. As the Chrome OS software gets better and as Web software gets better, its performance will get better, without a stitch or work or investment on your side. And when that inevitable moment comes when it's time to get the next shiny new Chrome-equipped machine, all you'll have to do to get there is to log in to it; say goodbye to all of the new-machine headaches that were part of the PC world.Is it a bit of a walk on the wild side to use a Chromebook? Yeah, sure. This is a machine with a brand-new operating system, after all, not to mention a whole new way of looking at how computers and the Web can work together. But in truth most of us are ahead of the PC and Mac world already. We're already on the Web almost all the time, using software reluctantly or out of necessity. So in a sense using a Chromebook is telling the computer world to get with the program and to support the Web the way that it was meant to be supported. But in the meantime, what you get is the Web, nothing but the Web (plus some files, if you must), anywhere, any time, the way that it was meant to be. My guess is that you'll be plenty happy almost all of the time with just that.

Reviews.Title: Avoid the Chromebook! - 6 month's experience and I totally regret my purchase.
Reviews.Author: ozob
Reviews.Content: If you think tech support is frustrating with Windows, wait until you deal with Samsung, HP (for the cloud printer) and Google.The concept is great but this is NOT ready for the public. The limits are maddening and it is very buggy!I have spent more than 4 1/2 hours today on a recurring issue: The sound won't play through the speakers when I re-open the unit. It is a known issue and discussed on the web but no one has a solution. As with most tech support solutions, Samsung wants me to do a hard re-set, which requires a 4gb flash drive that is set up from a 'windows, linux or mac' computer. Great! And the comments online say that this won't solve this issue! Samsung wants me to return the Chromebook and I'm out of luck for the time without a computer. THE ISSUE IS STILL NOT RESOLVED.There are so many bugs - the pages crash constantly and the videos are slow and jerky. Printing is a NIGHTMARE! I have spent hours on the phone with HP and I can't get this problems resolved. The print options with Chromebook are severely limited (you can't even choose the number of copies) and the windows don't display properly. Cloud printing is easy with my old Windows XP laptop, But when I try to print the same document with the Chromebook, the printer starts flashing and demands to be shut down. Other times, it says that the document was printed but nothing happens. Google blames HP, HP blames Google. NO RESOLUTION! And good luck getting someone from Google on the phone...There are so many other nuisances and bugs you'll discover as you use it. When typing in the web page or Google search, the pages show as loaded but nothing happens. This is a constant issue and I'm used to typing in the page on multiple tabs before it works. Reloading, etc. doesn't work. It makes no sense.I bought this for my son so that he could have easy access to the internet. I regret ever buying a Chomebook. I am savvy with Windows, networking, drivers, etc. but I am stuck when dealing with this 'paperweight'.If you are looking for a laptop for a school or business then AVOID THE CHROMEBOOKS! Don't be a guinea pig! The moment you have printer issues, sound problems, crashing pages and other numerous frustrations then you'll regret over-paying for this beta-product. Long battery life and quick boot times mean nothing if you can't use the laptop!I've never posted a comment on Amazon. But after another 4 1/2 wasted hours this morning with live chat and tech support, I want everyone to know what hassles await them when they buy this product. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: Does what it was built to do, and does it quite well.
Reviews.Author: Christopher R. Klapp
Reviews.Content: ChromeOS:This product is a Chromebook. It is meant to be the simplest way to browse the web. And it does an amazing job at it. Turn it on, instant web via ChromeOS, nothing more, nothing less. I recommend trying Chrome as your primary web browser for a while and imagine that that is all your computer can run. Do it before you purchase it. Sounds limiting at first, until you realize what is available post web 2.0. HTML5, CSS3 and many improvements over the past few years have made it possible to run most daily used applications in the cloud. Personally it doesn't do everything I need out of a computer and I still work from my MacPro, but it does 99% of everything off the clock.Pros:Perfect size for on the go.Well over 8 hours of battery life even when used for entertainment.The fastest/easiest way to access the web.100MB of free web each month via Verizon.Great battery life even when using Verizon 3G.Boots faster than I remember, every time.OS updates faster than a reboot of any other netbook OS.OS updates are quite frequent and improve the polish of the OS/Browser very often.No backups necessary and after reinstalling the OS from scratch, all files/preferences are restored automatically.Has flash, even though it is the only time the fan kicks on and the battery life dwindles quickly.Decent screen for the price but poor beside my glossy screened Apple devices.Cons:Anti-Glare screen absorbs and diffuses too much ambient light which reduces contrast and washes out the blacks.Sound volume is extremely low making it useless to watch Hulu, Netflix, Etc... without headphones.Flash kills the battery and heats up enough to cause the fan to come on.Power adapter seems very old school like it came with my 486 laptop of the 90's.Misconceptions:Many people expect it to do more than browse the web and miss the entire point to this niche market. Do you complain that an wireless tablet doesn't have an ethernet port? Of course not.Comparison:After switching to Apple products a few years ago, my standard of quality and ease of use changed greatly. This is no MacBook Pro/Air or even an iPad but it does have flash which was my wife's biggest complaint with our iPad/iPhones. At first the low framerate of flash video was horrible and it made watching videos choppy and unwatchable. Since the latest updates and the addition of the Netflix plugin it actually is a decent way to be entertained as well as browse the web. This is by far my favorite non Apple product and actually rivals the daily usage of my iPad.

Reviews.Title: Old generation Chromebook. Underpowered with Atom processor. New models are cheaper and better
Reviews.Author: David Pearlman "sound fanatic"
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a bad Chromebook when it came out a couple of years ago.But now it's a relic and there's no good reason to buy one, unless you can get it dirt cheap.The reason: This Chromebook uses the underpowered Atom processor. It is sluggish.Samsung has subsequently issued two new Chromebooks. You haveThe ex303c12, which is based on a state of the art ARM processor and retails for $250 ($330 with 3G): Samsung Chromebook (Wi-Fi, 11.6-Inch)and you haveThe Samsung model 550 (not to be confused with the Model 5), which is based on a fast Celeron processor. It retailed for around $500, but can be found for much less now used Samsung Series 5 550 Chromebook (Wi-Fi)Excluding the processor, the specs on these newer models are more-or-less the same as this one, with the ex302c12 adding USB3.0 and weighing about a pound less for good measure. (The 550 also has 4Gb of memory). They all run the exact same version of the operating system.There's also a $200 Chromebook from Asus that's faster than this one, and a $300 Chromebook from HP that's faster than this one (at time of writing). Neither of those is as slick as the Samsung line, but they are both a better deal and experience than this model.The bottom line is that there simply isn't ANY reason to buy this older model, which runs a lot more sluggishly, unless you can get it for a song--say, $100 or less--and you are willing to deal with that sluggishness.

Reviews.Title: Awesom
Reviews.Author: Ghost356
Reviews.Content: Love my Chromebook!  It's all I use now.  Paired with Google Drive I have everything I need all the time.  Quick boot, no virus issues, & no worries.  There is a small learning curve with the Chromebook & getting used to the keyboard was an adjustment but minor issues at best.  Google & Samsung have done a great job with this product.  If your a Google user this is a must have.

Reviews.Title: Don't expect this to be a replacement for a laptop and you'll love it!
Reviews.Author: RickN
Reviews.Content: I bought this to support my vacation and it's doing everything I ask.  It is light and easy to interact with, and having both wi-fi and wireless is great.  I do consider $500 too expensive for what it is but it can be purchased much cheaper (I did).  I am writing this review from my vacation hotel room on wi-fi and have checked up on things from a state park overlooking the ocean on wireless all with no effort at all.  I've been using it to upload digital pictures to web storage each day allowing family at home to enjoy them. If you don't care about touch screen capability, I don't, it is perfect for travel and the battery lasts all day.  It is slightly larger than a tablet but already has a keyboard and the screen is protected when closed and it fits perfectly into my smaller backpack.  The screen is perfect for outdoor usage, very sharp and clear in outdoor light.  The lack of normal printer support is a drawback but minor and the touch pad gestures are a little different from a laptop but very nice once used to them.  Don't try to make it something that it's not and you'll be happy that you bought it.

Reviews.Title: Chrombook for grad students in humanities
Reviews.Author: Graduate Student
Reviews.Content: I am a graduate student, which basically means that I write and read all the time. I must say that I am completely satisfied with the chromebook and couldn't ask for more, considering my lifestyle. When I bought chromebook I was rather worried about its inability to work offline, but now I find it as an advantage: there are plenty offline text editors that are installed on chromebook as an extension; plus all the googledocs are available online (I also life just fine without Microsoft Office). Hence, the fact that I can "turn off" the internet is the best thing in the world, since I also eliminate all the distractions at once, leaving myself only with my writing.The battery is great.  I never take the chord with me during the day. I charge the computer at night, go to the library, and with deemed screen, and the fact that it takes 2 seconds to turn it off and 8 seconds to turn it on, the computer easily lasts me a 12 hour day at the library - never a worry about plugging it in etc.I highly recommend this as an affordable solution to grad students and those who can say: whom am I kidding, I only use my computer to type, check email, read news, listen to music, read articles.  If that is your lifestyle, chromebook is great.

Reviews.Title: So happy I purchased this
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Words can't describe how much this laptop fits my needs. I work for an in-home healthcare agency and train Clinicians on electronic medical records. The Chromebook is perfect as it is simple for ANYONE to figure out. It's also secure as we tie it in with our Google Apps. The keyboard is easy to type on. The laptop is lightweight so it's easy to carry from house to house. The battery lasts all day. SSD harddrive is more reliable, the list goes on and on!

Reviews.Title: Incredible value, cutting-edge technology
Reviews.Author: C. Wihlidal
Reviews.Content: In this user's opinion, is the way of the future. Apple, Google and Microsoft are all investing heavily in web infrastructure to make their products universally accessible, whether they're accessed from an iPod, Android, desktop or tablet. Chromebooks are the evolution of the laptop, storing everything online thus freeing users the pain and fear of backups, theft, etc. My Chromebook is speedy and with 3G service I can get my data anywhere in the nation. It's a perfect travel companion.

Reviews.Title: Great product but one flaw
Reviews.Author: Michael C. Harris "Mikey"
Reviews.Content: So ive had my chromebook now for a few days and i must say this product is amazing. Ive used chrome for quite some time and it has been very useful. Having it as a operating system just makes life easier. After reading some other reviews i must point out that this product is not for everyone. If you use a laptop as your main computer then this is not a replacement. I have a desktop which is my main and use this chromebook for class and entertainment. Almost everything that you do on a computer can now be done on the web. Web design, photo edit, create pictures, music, anything you can think of there is a web app do it. It makes sense that you will only need a browser. The ONLY flaw i can think of is java. The chromebook does not come with java. There are workaround to get java installed but only if you are computer savvy. Thanks for the great device!

Reviews.Title: Fast, easy-to-use, and rock-solid
Reviews.Author: Christopher Trip "hello hello"
Reviews.Content: The more I use my Chromebook, the more I love it. Maintaining Windows can be a job unto itself. This removes everything but the essentials for what I do. (Google Docs, Email, Web Browsing, etc...). If you find yourself using your browser 90% of the time, you will love the ease and simplicity of this device.The almost instant-on availability coupled with a super-long battery life make this a device that is ready to go anywhere and everywhere.I highly recommend it for the right person--a person who does most everything on the web.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for web use
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "TelegramSam"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this ChromeBook. It's perfect for around the house web use. We have more powerful computers, but they are not as portable as the ChromeBook, which travels all around the house and yard with us. It's boot is fast and it's resume is near instant. It's great having background updates, and they never pop up or interfere as they do in both OSX and Windows. If you need another device to get online, I'd recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me; may not be for you.
Reviews.Author: Pudge
Reviews.Content: I wanted something I can use for the basics: internet, notes, reviewing PowerPoints/documents/spreadsheets. If you are looking for something to replace your computer, then I would suggest to look for something else based on your needs.Pros:- 8 to 10 hour battery life- Great keyboard- Large touchpad, centered. (Sometimes laptops have it awkwardly placed to much to the left which gets annoying when you are typing as you constantly end up moving cursor).- Matte screen (no reflections)- Does not heat up even with heavy use- Very quiet- For basic use, the processor / ram is sufficient- Cloud: all my music (Google Music) and documents (Google Docs) are stored online- Perfect size: I've used 10" netbooks, 14" laptops, 16" laptops, and I have to say this 12" is by far the best size.- Tons of apps on the market: I personally don't use many because, like I said, I use it for basic things listed above.Cons:- Have to upload and convert documents to Google Docs before viewing / editing or you get an error saying this file format is not compatible.- No left click / right click buttons: I would have preferred left click / right click buttons near the touchpad, but it's not that big of a deal. (You have to press down the touchpad to left click and press with 2 fingers for right click).I know a lot of people think this device is useless if there is no internet available. I'm not sure what you expect any other laptop to do without internet... I mean, I guess, you could browse your iTunes album list like I see many people doing in class when they can't connect to WiFi. All kidding aside, there isn't much to do with a laptop without an internet connection. You can still access your documents and take notes in offline mode on the Chromebook.Try it out at a store and make an informed decision. Hope this review helps! I love my Chromebook and have no buyers remorse.

Reviews.Title: Uber Brilliant !
Reviews.Author: Frank "pinup22"
Reviews.Content: ChromeOS is the future of computing without a doubt.  A lot of hating takes place on certain blogs as competitors smell fear.  Yes GOOGLE is going to take over the platform and Microsoft will fade further out of the picture.  Apple will remain a niche player.This Chromebook is simply BRILLIANT.  For anyone that uses the internet for about 90+% of their computer use this is the ticket.  Forget messing around with other Windows Based laptops and worring about "specs" of this computer vs that computer.  JUST PULL THE TRIGGER ON THIS SAMSUNG CHROMEBOOK!  You are going to love it!

Reviews.Title: Great for my wife who just wants to be online
Reviews.Author: Timothy Hellman
Reviews.Content: I bought this with my wife in mind who wanted a laptop to use around the house for checking email, staying up on Facebook, looking up recipes, printing occasionally, etc.So far it is a big hit. She loves how quickly it boots up and navigates to websites. Once I installed enough apps to let her access and edit MS Office docs (with Nexus InstalFree), showed her how to use Google Drive and Google Cloud Print, she has been a very happy camper!The battery life is good and the unit is very small and light and does't get as hot as some other notebooks.The only complaint so far is that is missing a delete button. Granted, ctrl-alt-del is not necessary for Chrome OS, but she still wants to be able to delete text after the cursor.Another difficulty that I hope to find a work around for is I can't get the chromebook to access my external hard drive plugged into my router. I would like her to have access to store and retrieve photos from that drive, but there seems to be no option to do that built in.Bottom line: this is great for someone willing to learn a little bit, but then just wants to get on line and do his or her thing.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, buy this computer 100%%%
Reviews.Author: Animation360
Reviews.Content: i luv it. if this computer was in stores it would be a wrap for the rest of them;) Great value for the money. Telling all my friends to purchase the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: HolidayNC
Reviews.Content: Received today; INCREDIBLY thin and light, boots up almost instantly... glossy finish does attract fingerprints, but not an issue for a netbook-style device.  Keyboard very responsive, I love the trackpad gestures.  The speakers do leave a bit to be desired, but that's what headphones are for.  Charges quickly and works exactly as you'd expect.  With the (almost all free) downloadable Chrome OS extensions available in the webstore and Google's cloud services, this is a fantastic option for travel or when you just don't feel like booting up your desktop device.  I seriously considered a tablet, but for $350 I was able to purchase this; why spend more than that for a device with similar functionality and no keyboard?Overall, VERY pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Tool
Reviews.Author: CONASAUGA
Reviews.Content: After a week of use I find the Chromebook to be an exceelent productivity tool. Many complaints I have read about here and elsewhere simply have not come up in my use. It has not frozen once and I find no websites that do not work. It does require a learning period and some experimentation. I would not purchase without 3g. The ability to use it on the go is a main feature. I see it as an Ipad with a full size keyboard. Display has excellent color. 3g works very well. Keyboard and track-pad are above average in quality. It will not not replace your desktop or laptop. However, it  is very easy to handle and carry. The ability to connect to the web on location or the in the car make it a very compelling device.2. After months of use I found a number of short-comings intolerable. I finally gave it to my nephew. Touch pad jerky. Many file formats are unreadable. On example is docs formatted under Apple Pages. Cannot have many tabs open at one time without seriously degrading performance. Wanted it to work but just don't think it has enough power to perform.

Reviews.Title: just right
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "kiwispouse"
Reviews.Content: i was pleased when google announced the chromebook as i fell in love with chrome at first use, and although we cannot purchase them here in new zealand yet (nor can we have them shipped), when my husband made a trip over he brought me this one back at my request (ok, more like plea). i appreciate its slimness and lightness in contrast to my work laptop; it's much easier to travel with. i love how fast it powers on, and the battery is definitely lasting me 8 hours, which is a major plus.  additionally, the price is fair enough. now that you can do just about anything online, you couldn't ask for anything easier.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Badger
Reviews.Content: Needed a small computer for traveling.  Love the Chromebook. It does everything I need it to do.  The battery life is just as long as advertised.  I would recommend this to any age computer surfer.

Reviews.Title: Great for web work
Reviews.Author: T. Kirkham "buyer of stuff"
Reviews.Content: Efficient.  QUICK boot. LONG battery life.  If you live in the cloud, you could hardly do better than a Samsung Chromebook.Some here have complained about it being flimsy.  I disagree.  It is plastic, but it seems sturdy and lightweight to me.  Bright screen, USB and SD reader.  Even 3G is built-in.  WiFi works great.If you have a desktop Windows computer with remote desktop support, add CloudRDP by Ericom and you have the power of a Windows box with the lightweight and long battery life of the Chromebook.I am giving it 4 stars because it has a keyboard without the PageUp, PageDn, Home, Delete or End keys.  I know that there are keyboard combinations for these, but a long-term power user will find this frustrating (I know I do).  I don't miss the F-keys they removed, but they should not have eliminated the navigation keys. If you never use these keys, you will not miss them.Google has recently introduced a desktop-style interface on their Beta channel which I think is a step backward.  At least they appear to be moving forward with Chrome OS, but I am still concerned about the long-term evolution of Chrome OS, and how long this particular model will be supported with updates.  Only time will tell if Google abandons Chrome OS in favor of Android.Here is how I use various technology platforms:1) I use Windows for Outlook, Quickbooks and application running (including Word and Excel - I find the offerings from Google slow and feature-lacking although most users would not notice).  Its tough to beat Windows for business use.2) Chromebook for web work.3) Kindle (black and white) for consuming books - no eyestrain.4) Television for consuming movies and TV shows (coupled with an Apple TV and AT&T; Uverse).5) Jailbroken iPhone for portable RSS reading and of course, phone calls.

Reviews.Title: great for light computing!
Reviews.Author: carlsberg
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something just for internet and light document work (i.e., writing, making spreadsheets, etc) and not for things like serious image or video editing, this is a great option. It's relatively inexpensive, it updates itself all the time, and it runs SO fast! I've worked extensively with Macs, PCs, and even Linux - nothing boots up or runs as quickly as my Chromebook. I've definitely recommended it for all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: Its my main computer!!!!
Reviews.Author: T. Loposser
Reviews.Content: I have access to multiple windows laptops and desktops and Mac desktops and laptops and this by far is my go to machine for daily use. Matter of fact this was written on it! Super fast turn on time, there is no wait at all to get online. So light its crazy and battery life is unbeatable. Buy it and laugh at people getting Windows and yes even Mac viruses.

Reviews.Title: Best machine I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: John C Peck II
Reviews.Content: Best machine I've ever owned!  I would recommend it to any Google fan or any computer novice / granny just learning.  It's an excellent replacement for anyone living online completely! Enough said.  Buy one.

Reviews.Title: Love the keyboard, hate the mouse.
Reviews.Author: Dustin W
Reviews.Content: First Impressions:I don't have a desktop in the house and only use laptops, switching to the samsung chromebook's keyboard was so easy. Keys that were normally hidden on other laptop keyboards like volume and screen brightness are front and center on the chromebook.  I highly suggest learning the other keyboard shortcuts, ctrl+alt+? to see them all displayed.The mouse was more disappointing, again I am very proficient with the trackpad on laptops and I have been troubled by the chromebook's oversized pad.  The pad is so large that I find it difficult to only rest my index finger and thumb on the pad.  I have to stretch or hold out my other three fingers so they don't touch the pad.  Whenever they do, watch out, the mouse pointer goes crazy!  Don't get me started on the twister style maneuver you have to perform to right click.Other Thoughts:I would compare the chromebook's performance with a netbook, the samsung chromebook beats the pants off the netbooks I have seen.  There are two things that I cannot do on my chromebook, play angrybirds HD and play youtube HD.  If you are ok with angrybirds SD and youtube 480p, this is your powerhouse.Conclusion:Over all, I really do like the chromeOS. I do wish there were a few more user options, like leave the system on with the lid closed or adjust the idle time to sleep (annoying when listening to music).Google promises offline doc apps and tighter google app integration coming this summer, so I have something to look forward to.

Reviews.Title: Did not meet expectations
Reviews.Author: Daniel Genzink
Reviews.Content: I love gmail, chrome, and everything google does. Knowing that I was purchasing a machine that focused completely around chrome, I'm just a tad letdown.Here are just some observations while using the product over the past week.Hardware: the size and weight is great. inputs and outputs are adequate. However, for a machine that "gets better over time" as google advertises, the hardware may be limiting. It's a solid casing, so there's no way to install a new battery or carry an extra one for backup. Also, it's a standard plug from the power cord to the computer (not magnetic), so that will ware out over time, especially if you're trying to get the most out of the battery by unplugging it when it's completely charged.Some people have mentioned that there is no caps lock key, but that's not a big deal. (who uses that anyway?) The only key I miss is the Delete key, for when I want to delete characters in-front of the cursor.streaming video: I watch mlb.tv and other live sports online and it works quite well.web browsing: I'll have 3 or 4 tabs open and 3 or 4 extensions running (google voice, google talk, scratch pad) and I'll get a notification that one of the extensions has crashed or I'll get that "he's dead jim" blue screen when a chrome web page crashes. This is happening about 2 or more times a day.File management: I plugged in a usb thumb drive with a bunch of different files and it only recognized pictures. So, I couldn't open up a word doc directly from the thumb drive; you have to go to google docs and then open it from there. I also can't find web app that will play avi video files from the thumb drive.Battery: as we all know, the battery life is great. When the battery is dead and you begin charging, it says it will take about 3 hours to charge. However, even when the computer is completely powered down, the final "20 minutes" takes a little over an hour, so it's about 3.5 hours for a charge. Because I watch a lot of video, I'm not sure how long it lasts for normal use, but right now it says the battery has 4% left and 2 hrs; this makes no sense.Processing power: If this is a machine that is supposed to get better over time, I believe the processing power will be the limiting factor. Having an HD sports program in the background while doing something else isn't the smoothest of operations. As apps become more advanced in the future and need more processing power, I'm not sure how the chromebook will hold up.That being said, if you want the portability, long battery life, and quick access to the web, this is a great machine.Let me know if you have any questions by leaving a comment.Thanks!Dan.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER -- It is a SCAM!
Reviews.Author: Richard Cappadona
Reviews.Content: THIS SELLER ("CRAVING SAVINGS") IS A SCAM!!! DO NOT BUY FROM THEM! They sold me a Samsung Chromebook, which I returned to order a different computer. However, even though I returned the computer, CravingSavings REFUSED to process my refund, even after SELLING MY COMPUTER TO ANOTHER PERSON. This person contacted me to ask for my information, which was still logged into the computer -- the seller didn't even bother to wipe my info off the computer! They merely resold my computer to make a DOUBLE PROFIT on the device. They refused to even ACKNOWLEDGE that I had sent the computer back to them, and they REFUSED TO REFUND MY MONEY! This seller may ROB YOU BLIND and they do NOT CARE about customer service or even being decent human beings. Please do NOT purchase anything from this seller -- if I can save even one person from going through this SCAM, then I am pleased. I lost hundreds of dollar because of these SCAMMERS, do NOT let it happen to you!

Reviews.Title: A nice netbook, but not much else
Reviews.Author: Justin Husted
Reviews.Content: This is a good little netbook for productivity or checking the internet. I had a hard time doing all of my work on it because of it's size. Playing a game, anything other than a really basic flash game, ended up being to much computing power for the processor and the same thing goes for Netflix and some YouTube videos.Additionally, no delete button and having a search button where the caps lock button usually would be is also a deterrent (though these are available with the visual keyboard setting). Lastly, because it is so thin, the power chord cracked and broke where it inserts into the computer. A new one is around $20 on Amazon and may be worth picking up so that you have a spare.Overall, I liked the Chromebook and the Chrome OS, there have been some bugs, but Google has been relatively quick in fixing them. For $250, this was a decent laptop, but I certainly would have been discouraged had I paid full price for it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Series 5 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: M. B. Carvalho
Reviews.Content: This product is great. I even wonder whether it should have received 5 stars. Why did I give it 4 stars? Probably because I would have loved it to have a faster processor and the possibility of adding another 2 Gb of RAM to it; but then I realise it would have been a different price, so fair enough! The product fully satisfies my expectations. I was slightly sorry/concerned that the product was delivered (by USPS) to an uncovered part of the house, where it could have been damaged by rain (which fortunately was not the case). I bought the product second-hand (through Amazon Market place) and I didn't realise, when I purchased it, that I would not have the benefit of the 100 Gb cloud storage at Amazon (because second-hand products are not eligible for that, which is a real shame, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I have been using my chromebook for over a year now, and still love it as much as the day I got it.  Don't expect it to replace all of your computing needs, but as a secondary computer it is great.  I use it while I am relaxing around the house and just need to browse the web.  Its light weight, and incredible battery life make the much more useful than a laptop.  I use this way more than my much more expensive tablet.

Reviews.Title: It's no speed demon
Reviews.Author: Prisoner zero
Reviews.Content: I have an affectionate attachment to this device. It's not the speediest laptop or the prettiest. The concept of the Chrome browser/operating system was well executed. The ability to have your personal settings linked to a gmail account gives it the ability to be a personal laptop for multiple users. I bought it to serve as the house laptop. Mostly for guests to use. I occasionally use it myself when my Samsung series 9 runs out of battery.  It has no bells or whistles but it is highly functional for most of your basic internet needs. While it lacks in speed. I can only imagine that future generations of Chromebooks will have increased speed and possibly processing power. I will most likely purchase one of the newer models in the future. If nothing else to satisfy my curiosity  to see how the next generation has improved.If your computing needs are limited to browsing, email or chat this would serve you fine and save you some money.

Reviews.Title: junk hardware, great OS
Reviews.Author: Autodidact "inetfilm"
Reviews.Content: I like the Chromium OS, its nicely designed and easy to use. I didn't like the product because the Samsung hardware is junk. The browser is very slow, it can barley play flash videos on you tube, the built in speakers are useless, the screen has a terrible viewing angle from almost all angles the color is sub par. The battery dies if not plugged in for a few days even if you dont use it. I hope the product gets better in time but I would not recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook 2nd generation Samsung 5 550 1.3ghz celeron 4gb ram
Reviews.Author: Chuck Davis
Reviews.Content: Just got my Chromebook 5 550 on 9-26-12. Boot up time is like 8 seconds and shutting down the chromebook is a few seconds. Chromebook is pretty easy to use. Since i use Chrome web browser on my laptop and sync the bookmarks and my Gmail to the chrome browser it will also be synced to the chromebook. Since i don't use a laptop for anything else other then being o the web the Chromebook works out good for me. Battery life is pretty good. Took it to Starbucks and had the screen on on half lit for 2 hours and still had about 5 1/2 hours left on  the battery. There are a lot of apps you can download for free and has a forum to get answers if you are having a problem with the Chromebook or find out more about the chromebook. I had a few glitches and a few times the chromebook froze. I just rebooted the device back up and it was good to go. Keyboard is is pretty good and easy to type. Hardware seems sturdy to me. resolution is good enough for my needs. Web surfing is pretty fast. Great fro watching youtube. sometimes i use a lot of tabs 6 to 8 tabs. Sometimes its slows down and i have to reboot but for the most part it doesn't slowdown. Periodically it gets a update. When this one came out it was on chrome 19 now it is on chrome 21 version. The best thing i like about the chromebook is there is no need for anti virus no need to download the updates like a windows and it doesn't slow down after. If your downloading pictures from the internet i save it to google drive not to the 16gb drive cause you can not view it unless you upload to the google drive. There are a ton of apps which i haven't explored that much yet. I you are using the web a lot this is something to look at.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Jen L
Reviews.Content: I purchased the chromebook for my trip to Comic Con where I needed to cover several panels and live blog.  The chromebook was amazing for this purpose.  It easily connected to the free wireless even though several others had issues.  It was light and easy to carry around all day and the battery life was fantastic.I really like the option of being able to connect to Verizon's 3G network however the one time I did have to use it there was no warning when the time was about to expire and I couldn't add more time because you have to be connected to the internet.  That was my only complaint.Overall this product is perfect for traveling when you don't want to being your actual laptop, it easily connects to free wireless and has the built in 3G just keep an eye on your time so you can add more if necessary.

Reviews.Title: You wouldn't think this is 2012
Reviews.Author: Jason Radak
Reviews.Content: I just tried to use my Chromebook at my local coffee shop and couldn't connect to the wifi. I know this is an issue with the computer and not the network because my Android phone connected immediately. Shouldn't a product like this be able to connect easily to any wireless network? Especially since it's useless without an internet connection? I bought this product thinking it would be free of the bugs that plague Windows products, but I was clearly wrong. You'd think that connecting to a wireless router wouldn't be a huge problem in 2012.

Reviews.Title: unusable trackpad, mediocre experience
Reviews.Author: David Jeske "tech savvy"
Reviews.Content: I want to like the chromebook. An end to computer administration and a thin web app Experience? Sounds nice.Sadly, any hope of utility in this machine is eliminated by the horiffic track pad. Physically clicking my trackpad was almost impossible. Dragging was quite bad as well.Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Finally a new OS to eclipse all others
Reviews.Author: D. May
Reviews.Content: I was not sure whether to give 5 stars or 1 star.  I give Chromebook 5 stars on the concept which will transform the world even more than the Google search bar.  Cloud computing -- we're all going to be living in the Cloud.  Chromebook is more revolutionary than the first Apple or the Windows OS.  As an aside, the track pad takes the concept of the mouse to a new level.  Now the one star part -- Chromebook is improving rapidly and always updating your OS automatically.  That means that there are lots of rough edges right now.  The developers will be swamped with bug reports -- they'll be overloaded for a while.  Eventually Chromebook will make Windows obsolete for most things.  So if you want to get in on the bleeding edge Chromebook is for you.  If you just want to do Gmail and YouTube, you'll be okay and have a lot of fun playing.  There are many third party apps -- mostly free -- but about half of them don't work.  Crashes are very common for apps that do start to work.  Other apps seem to be dead on arrival.  Still others are way more complicated than they need to be.  Its a joy to discover a good app, and it gets frustrating trying all the bad ones to get to a good one.  But then you get to give a rating and write a review, and with millions doing this, Chromebook will rapidly become better than Windows.  A new era of computing is starting with Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: chromebook
Reviews.Author: duncan
Reviews.Content: The tablet is really good.  The chromebook software works well. Waiting anxiously for the chrome web store to become more robust. Not being able to exit the browser feels awkward. Underwhelmed by living in the cloud - glad I have other tools to do more robust work.

Reviews.Title: Great Device But ChromeOS Still Needs Work. A Bit Pricey Too
Reviews.Author: T. Hilton
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Chromebook is a good piece of hardware. The trackpad is solid, the keyboard feels great to type on and the screen is bright and clear. The battery life is amazing: 14 hours of solid use.ChromeOS is a great idea but it's still in it's infancy. It lacks some of the features that would make it a viable for every day use. Once the Citrix Receiver comes out and a little bit more polish from Google on the UI (specifically in dealing with local files and USB)My only real complaint is the price. $500 is about double what I think this device is worth. Considering you can get a full power laptop loaded with 4 GB of RAM and an i3 processor for the same price.I'm hopeful for the future of ChromeOS. But we need cheaper hardware and more polish from Google.

Reviews.Title: I'm totally in love!!
Reviews.Author: Idrialis
Reviews.Content: I'm totally in love.... This is totally as described... If you plan to live in the cloud and Googleness.. this is your product!

Reviews.Title: Nice!!!!
Reviews.Author: malcomson
Reviews.Content: Love the speed and convenience. I've had 3 windows PCs in the last 4 years and have had problems with all of them in the first year. I have a Mac for work, so I use that for the heavy lifting. This is a perfect to have sitting on the coffee table for casual browsing, or travel. It's light, clean looking, very fast, and me lady has her own sign in, so she can't see what I'm looking at...$$$$.I started off with Android G1 then moved to the Nexus 1 and I believe Chrome OS will follow in Android's footsteps and keep getting better with updates, so I plan on having this beauty for a long time. The battery life is amazing. It lasted 3 days with moderate browsing. Never turned if off, only sleep mode. I'm sold.

Reviews.Title: brand new
Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: exactly what i expected. brand new. works perfect it is fast. i dont have much else to say, but i need more words

Reviews.Title: 3G?
Reviews.Author: Peter Livingston
Reviews.Content: I thought that this was something special, but there was no 3G and I couldn't install anything on it..

Reviews.Title: Under Par Performance
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I have found this Samsung product to be consistently frustrating.  I bought it to send & receive emails.  Many of my emails have been erased mid-composition before they have been sent.  The cause is unknown.  Customer service tells me to send the unit from northern California, where I live, to Texas, where it will take weeks to service & return.  There is, of course, a charge for warranty service as well as shipping.  I have now replaced it with another brand, eliminating having to wait for long distance service.  The new product has none of the Samsung problems & is more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Actually Love it but the power adapter issues (5 stars otherwise)
Reviews.Author: KBA
Reviews.Content: I hope to be able to get this repaired because the power plug-in adapter on side of ChromeBook seems to be going bad. I am having to be very careful when plugging into the actual chromebook to get any power charge.  This is sad too, because I love this unit and the Cjrome world of using at end of day while winding down (no worries of spam / viruses) while N level speed for wireless adapter.....  if anyone knows how I can get this repaired without much costs, love to hear...

Reviews.Title: Intuitive
Reviews.Author: C. Sakamoto "Hoplow"
Reviews.Content: Samsung did a great job filling the gap between smartphone and laptop.  It is good for internet browsing and social media.  Does a better job than a Windows OS netbook.Very intuitive design.  We were up and on the internet in less than 5 minutes.  Starts up in secords.

Reviews.Title: It kept freezing for STOP PLUGINS
Reviews.Author: XCT
Reviews.Content: I bought it just to play games on Facebook.. (Farmville & Slingo), just for those two games the laptop keep freezing/stop and ask for STOP PLUGGINS, I search the internet for the fix, and whatever I try (even the answer from Chromebook forum) it still keeps doing that.. which is really annoying & beat the purpose of me buying this laptop.The good thing is there's no virus & I can update/reverse to factory setting often & easy..

Reviews.Title: Came promptly, in great shape
Reviews.Author: Eboni
Reviews.Content: I was scared when I first got it because the plastic covering on it was so scratched up and I thought it was the actual laptop that was scratched. Luckily it was only the plastic and the laptop itself was in perfect condition. Great buy, no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: David Watson
Reviews.Content: Good unit for google based internet searching.We returned because my wife did not like the screen size for her type of activity,

Reviews.Title: Love this little Note Book!
Reviews.Author: M. Davidson "Matt"
Reviews.Content: Sold my 1yr old Windows Laptop and been cruising around on my new Google Chrome book running Chrome OS. Can't say enough good things about this! Its fast, sleek and so simple, I love it. I had no idea I had such fast WiFi!It won't be replacing traditional computers.... yet, but hey it's Google, give'em a few years and who knows???Watch out MicroApple!It really is much faster at loading webpages than my windows machine.  Funny thing is my windows machine was kind of cheep, one of those cyber monday deals - ended up costing me about $300.  Paid slightly more for this thing and it is SO much better!  All I wanted was a device for the family area to browse the web.  I'll have to keep my other main computer for installing regular software...  on that note, my biggest gripe so far is when using google docs for spreadsheets is their online version isn't quite as nice as MS Office.  I spent hours trying to figure out how to do a subscript, only to find that feature is only aviable in their 'Word' version but not in the 'Excel' version.  I'm sure that will change with time.Bottom line this is a great OS and machine for what it is designed for.

Reviews.Title: google chrome os
Reviews.Author: Son Q Tran "Tran"
Reviews.Content: very nice labtop on the go, the 16gb ssd very fast booting ddr III 2gb enouch for system upgrade for more better.

Reviews.Title: Not Very Good
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B.
Reviews.Content: I returned this computer for 2 reasons.1. It kept disconnecting me from the internet every 15-20 minutes and took just as long to reconnect. I looked up this problem and several others were experiencing the same thing. I tried to fix it but was unable.2. I didn't like how there was absolutely no operating system just a browser. I did like that this make the netbook faster, but  saving or editing documents was nearly impossible. There is very little storage on this computer and when you do try to save something it's hard to access and modify.*(Also Netflix does not work with this device either)I thought this would suit my needs but it came up short... maybe in a year or 2 when Google works these kinks out.

Reviews.Title: start up problems
Reviews.Author: Toddsshare
Reviews.Content: Was excited when the unit arrived..on time as usual. However, I kept getting an error message during start up. Had to contact Samsungs tech support. For about 45 minutes we tried to figure out the problem. Unfortunately we were unsuccessful. I have to return the lapto and purchase a new one. So for now I will give the entire experience a 3 star...mostly because of the curtious support I received from Samsung and the efforts they went through to figure the problem out. Ill update when I get the new unit and expect to upgrade the rate.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for light everyday use.
Reviews.Author: Topolino
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect everyday companion, bought mine used off of CL with not much hope but it kept surprising me with how reliable and effective it is. I think this is the future. Battery still runs strong, I charge my phone more than I charge this Chromebook.I recommend this to anybody who wants something personal to surf the internet, watch videos, listen to the music, using google docs for creating editing documents, editing photos using some apps etc.

Reviews.Title: It works perfectly
Reviews.Author: gter1965 "gter1965"
Reviews.Content: Finally after a chromebox I was able to buy a chromebook series 5 from a friend in Austria. I was a little doubtful about this purchase because I read all the reviews on Amazon and Amazon.co uk and almost all said this netbook with intel atom 570 had alot of problems to play youtube videos. At the end I decided to buy because I really like this version with the white lid. Well I was really pleasantly surprised how fast it is. Everything works perfectly and since the last update chrome 22 on beta channel I must say that is very very fast. It plays youtube perfectly, unfortunately netflix is not available in Czech Republic but all the video and series stored on the different television webpage for example SVT play for Sweden and ivysilany for Czech Republic which are full of videos contentare all available and fully visible. To set the computer was a real breeze and immediately i found the same bookmarks and application I have on chromebox.I really like and love this kind of computer because it is really immediately intuitive more than mac, windows and linux. BTW I already sold my ibook and powerbook that I had at home after several years good performance but it was almost embarassing the comparison with this chromebook samsung series 5.Some cons? Well maybe the touchpad at the beginning can give some small problems but only at the beginning, and about the chromeos? Well I would like to see on webstore an application like Vlc for video and Trainz for games, for the rest I'm completely super satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great at what it is designed to do!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: We got this for my wife.  95% of what she does on the computer is on the internet and she hates to wait for the machine to boot up.  This is ideal for her.  We are also really pleased with how compact it is.UPDATE:At first I didn't like the click pad.  Now when I am using our other laptop I miss it.  The longer we have this the more I like it.

Reviews.Title: A great mini.
Reviews.Author: ralph mag
Reviews.Content: This is great mini. I love the Chrome handling. I have it on my dell and they work back and forth. I can put some items on this and pick it up on my dell. I was able to move all my favorites or bookmarks from the dell to the Chromebook. I am still learning to use it after having it about two months. The max  battery is about 7 1/2 hours.I did pay a little more than what it is listed for today. I am having much fun using it.There is a small book to get started. I ordered a kindle book that has all the bells and whisles that someone has written. This is my first review. It was purchased from Amazon. My wife has a Kindle and most of my purchases from Amazon are for her ebooks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, this is the future of computing.
Reviews.Author: J. J. Ortiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. very simple and straightforward. If you're a heavy Google user (Gmail, Docs, Calendar) this product makes a lot of sense to purchase. No more Windows or Mac software troubles, Chrome OS by Google just works. Enter your Gmail account during set up and that's it, you're good to go!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Mark van Brenk
Reviews.Content: I love my Chromebook. That could be my entire review, except that Amazon wants at least 20 words. I am a writer who is working on his first novel and a myriad of short stories. Having a pen and pad is nostalgic and wonderful but not practical these days.Sitting down at my PC or using a laptop was fine, but each had their detractors. To put it simply, the Chromebook boots up nearly instantly, is highly accessible and usable, makes managing documents easy with Google Drive and is one of the few netbooks/notebooks I have ever used with a decent keyboard.

Reviews.Title: TL;DR It's for web browsing
Reviews.Author: Jace "Jace"
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple computer.  That is why I bought it.  I only planned to browse the web and it's great at that.  It does not support Silverlight or Java a this time and who knows if it will soon.  Most websites don't require that.

Reviews.Title: MrWOF
Reviews.Author: Bill Florer "mrflorer"
Reviews.Content: Google Apps makes this product work well. I really enjoy the quick start up and shut down.  Superior keyboard. Very light.

Reviews.Title: Connecting this machine to Ethernet w/o WiFi
Reviews.Author: Peter Dora
Reviews.Content: Here is a way to get on line by direct Ethernet connection rather than by WiFi:Plugable USB 2.0 to 10/100 Fast Ethernet LAN Network RJ45 Adapter (ASIX AX88772 chipset)Just plug it in, click 'disable wifi' and you are all set.

Reviews.Title: Simple, uncomplicated
Reviews.Author: Stephen John Herron
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Series 5 3G Chromebook is one of the first commercially-available laptops using Google's operating system.First impressions are very positive - it's an attractive device, even closed, with a good weight to it. It feels solid, not cheap.The screen is excellent - clear, matte and bright.The keyboard is also superb, and a pleasure to work on.The trackpad isn't as good - I found myself wanting to use a mouse, though I've not tested one yet with the Chromebook.The lack of Bluetooth functionality is a bit annoying, especially if you'd prefer to use a wireless mouse.The initial setup takes between 10 and 15 minutes, including setting up Verizon's free 100Mb per month. That process was clumsy and annoying, and I find the data prices to be slightly absurd. I already pay $35 a month for data on my iPad, and I feel like I should be able to share this data with my Chromebook.Once everything has been setup, the startup time is incredibly fast; less than 5 seconds the first time in after setup.Everything feels fast and effective, and it is odd not having a desktop but just a browser window.I use Chrome on all other platforms, so it feels very natural here. I use Google Docs a lot, having published 3 books using it as a collaborative tool. The Series 5 handles those online apps with ease.The Series 5 feels like a laptop, not a netbook. The form factor is just the right size to get some work done, as long as you have an internet connection (since the free 100mb a month doesn't really amount to much). I would use this over the iPad to get work done on the go, though the iPad is obviously a more versatile device. If I was traveling for a couple of days, I might bring the Series 5 instead of my 13" Macbook Pro, though only if I didn't intend to get any "heavy" work done.All-in-all a solid start to the Chromebook line. If you're looking for a simple, uncomplicated device for web browsing and some light work (though increasingly more serious work can be done via Google docs), then you might want to think about a Chromebook and in particular, the Samsung Series 5. It's a solid device for a frequent traveler, as long as you're willing to pay the premium for Verizon's 3G internet. '

Reviews.Title: AN EXCELLENT COMPUTER BUT NO SKYPE.
Reviews.Author: M. Brooks Michel
Reviews.Content: IT IS EXCELLENT, STARTS IN SECONDS, HAS A SOLID STATE MEMORY, A BRIGHT SCREEN BUT DOES NOT WORK WITH SKYPE, THIS WAS NEVER MENTION IN THE AMAZON DESCRIPTION OF THE PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: speakers failed after one month
Reviews.Author: doug
Reviews.Content: I loved this thing, especially on trips and at the airport, but the speakers completely failed and I can't get any support for it.  Googling doesn't show any answers for this problem, and it makes certain sites and apps (like google video chat and netflix) unusable.Other than that my only other minor complaint is that it gets a bit sluggish at times - you just have to remember it's basically a netbook - it's got a netbook processor.I grabbed an asus transformer android tablet recently for a project, and I'd have to say it's probably better than this.  It still supports google video chat and netflix and so forth, but additionally runs all the other android apps, plus you get the touch interface and widgets and detachable keyboard.

Reviews.Title: interesting...
Reviews.Author: R. Robinson "Dharma Keeper"
Reviews.Content: Amazon and best buy will starting saling the chromebook on June 15th...However, I expect prices to drop considerably within the first 3 months...just to damn pricey!  First, I am a test pilot user and find the product refreshing and highly useful. But I just dont know why Google didnt go ahead and offer a tablet version and 2 or 3 netbook versions (a wifi and a 3g, which should be a 4g) instead of the 5 netbook versions? People want tablets! Besides, it would do what android tablets havent been able to do. Also, android and its marketplace are at a critical junction with the fragmentation that is occurring, sure to cause consternation both in the consumer and the developer world, as its lifespan continues.Most important for Chrome OS survivability is the fact that web and software developers will have to tailor and support their programs for Chrome, which will take a while but undeniably will happen, once the popularity of the OS and cloud computing usage in general increases, but first a price drop for these devices; Google must get them into the hands of everyone with a couple of extra dollars in their pockets and the desire to find a new OS (which there are many of), even if it means doing it at a loss (see: the kindle). Eventually Google is going to run into the classic "guns versus butter" quandary with all its operating systems out there. Ill place my money on its ONLY TRUE OPEN OS, the Chrome OS (android is by invite only until Google decides to release version's source code). Chrome is more than just a browser, any browsing on goggle labs will convince you of that! So why not capitalize on its unified design/operating concept and install it as an OS? This is what many people dont "get about Chrome as an OS, the say "I have chrome on my computer already"...in a few years pretty much all of your operations will exist in/on the cloud.SOME GOOD:  All of the chromebooks weigh in at about 3lbs, or twice the wight of the ipad2, which is still very light. Also, battery life is pretty identical to the advertised specs.  Boot time is ridiculously fast, less than 10 secs from a dead sleep! Amazon's cloud player is integrated very, very nicely integrated. Most important Chrome OS function: you DONT have to pay for web applications as you do with iOS or Android OS (unless site owners wish to charge for content, that is).SOME BAD:  No HDMI but a VGA instead (yeah, I know, its 2011). No bluetooth, NO GPS, webcam issues, cant use USB drives...most of the issues (I did not list several others) can be patched through updates. However some are hardware and will need to be addressed next production run or model design.  I recommend any of the SAMSUNG chromebooks w/the dual core Atom n570 cpu.The cpu will cut down significantly on streaming video stuttering that the acer chromebook will see (only the acer wifi only version has the N570, but a smaller screen though; as of June 2011 pay the few extra dollars and get the Samsung 3g unit...  On a final note: I almost wish I hadnt bought my ipad2, but I got tired of waiting for the chromebook to release and needed a portable computing device(I dont use windows netbook/laptops or Mac's. I will however grudgingly settle for chrome on a netbook). I suppose now  I can now wait for chrome OS to be released on a tablet before letting go of the ipad; hopefully a Chrome OS tablet will come before xmas.

Reviews.Title: Both and hardware and software needs more work
Reviews.Author: Bhaumin Shah
Reviews.Content: Was not satisfied with the hardware as well as software:-Some of the keys did not work perfectly (h,m). Double types it even if I press it only once.-The Trackpad seemed risen from the bottom portion.-Chrome OS still feels a bit premature. Needs more work.

Reviews.Title: Low Quality Laptop, Chrome OS is great
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: After only 3 months of constant use, the charging pin located inside the power cable input hole came loose. Can't charge my laptop so I guess it's dead. Hopefully Samsung replaces my Chromebook.Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Series 5 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Kevin R. Foster
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Samsung Series 5 Chromebook to test several of our online systems for a proposal we were putting together for a School District in NJ.The hardware was what you would expect for a low cost notebook computer. My biggest beef was with the trackpad. It was problematic. I do not think this model will take a lot of abuse.Access to Google Docs was flawless. If you can live within the confines of Google's Chrome browser, this Chromebook may provide a low cost computing solution.

Reviews.Title: Hardware failure
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: It worked great for a little over 2 weeks but then it began to shut off in the middle of using it. I believe that it was over heating. After I allowed it to cool down I again tried to power it on and the computer itself started but the screen was black and a spot on the lower left hand side of the screen was HOT to the touch. It has not worked since. The OS is great but the hardware is far from par.

Reviews.Title: Chromebooks ... all the way to the year 2000!
Reviews.Author: Relentless "skepticalbeliever"
Reviews.Content: After playing with my Samsung "Series 5" Chromebook for a while (in fact, I'm writing this review with it), I have to say that they are great, neat devices. Fast "cold" startup, true. It's up and running in less than 10 seconds, as advertised. Wakes up/resumes instantly, true. Again, as advertised. Cloud connected, true. Awesome battery life, true. Slick design, true. So, why did I give a pitiful two-star rating you ask? Three main reasons:1. Price/Value2. Connectivity3. Utility1. In as neat as these devices are, for what they do and the features it offers, it's grossly overpriced. You can get the more functionality, MUCH better performance, many more features from a "conventional" laptop for just about the same price.2. Google's vision of cloud-connected devices falls apart if you are in a place where connectivity is not possible or simply unaffordable. In-flight or out in the boondocks, for instance. With this device no connection means you have a glorified brick in your hands.3. This is where I think all boils down to. What does this computer do (disregarding Google's marketing and hype)? It's an internet terminal ... and that's it. It will not edit your videos, it doesn't run Photoshop, it doesn't run any local games (or Steam, for that matter), you can't install any of your favorite content authoring software, can't play CDs/DVDs, doesn't have family censorship tools and let's not even talk about how utterly useless this device is for those in the software development field. And all that would be perfectly fine if point 1 and 2 above weren't there. If this machine were, say, $150 the tradeoffs would make perfect sense. You're trading usability/utility for an inexpensive device. But at current prices, it's simply not worth it. Too many alternatives, too many limitations. In essence you are paying a few hundred dollars for a Chrome web browser (which, by the way, can be FREELY downloaded and installed on just about ANY computer).My, so-called TL;DR: Neat machine, poor utility, poor value.

Reviews.Title: Great if you are always on. Falls short for everything else
Reviews.Author: Tiffany B Brown "tiffanybbrown"
Reviews.Content: I use internet services to do an awful lot. In fact, I use Google's services for an awful lot. I am using a browser window 75%+ of the time I am using a computer. But there are times when I do not have connectivity and still need to be productive.This is where Chromebook comes up short: highly limited offline capabilities. Chromebook needs to be able to reach Google's servers in order to authenticate you. Otherwise you have to log in as a guest. But if you do that, you can't save any data because it will be wiped out when you log out. This is a problem when you have WiFi on planes or hotels that require you to log in or sign up before your device can connect to the internet.If most of what you do online involves web-based services, and you find yourself in places with WiFi 99% of the time, this may actually fit your needs. It also makes a great second computer.I would recommend getting a fuller-fledged notebook -- Macbook Air, an ultraportable Dell -- if you find yourself on planes and in hotels a lot and want to do work. The Chromebook is literally just a web browsing appliance: a browser, screen and keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Can't track this
Reviews.Author: Joshua Hadley
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to separate a review of a Chromebook from a review of ChromeOS, but I'll try to stick to the hardware aspects as much as possible.For the most part, it is a cheap plastic laptop. It is nice and thin, but feels pretty flimsy. The display is OK, not awesome, but doesn't suck either. I don't like the keyboard; I'm always mis-typing keys. The power supply cable worries me a bit: the pin is very small and the whole thing does not feel like it quite fits right. The worst is the trackpad, and I'm not sure how much of this is software or hardware/driver but it is absolutely terrible. No amount of adjusting the sensitivity seems to get it to feel right; the cursor is jumpy, scrolling is erratic, etc. I'd say, if you like a large screen and don't care about quality too much, then this might be the product for you. But if you prefer a better build quality and don't care so much about size, you might consider a different netbook as you could get one for right around the same price point.I'll leave the review of ChromeOS for someone else/someplace else but I would definitely advise anyone getting a Chromebook to make sure they understand the differences between the ChromeOS "the system is a browser" approach versus a traditional operating system...you may be in for some surprises.

Reviews.Title: Will Sell You Mine for $250 (half the price)
Reviews.Author: Gary Oppenheimer "Muzik Luvah"
Reviews.Content: The mousepad sucks. You can't get around unless you use your own external mouse. The OS limits your ability to use all of the web, because unlike Linux (upon which it is based) you can't install any plugin you want. The OS cannot do Java or any app that relies on Java (so if you're a business guy who uses gotomypc, you're out of luck). Again, if you want to buy this for cheap. I haven't yet activated the 100mb free 3g/month. This might be good for you. Contact me through amazon.

Reviews.Title: The Absolute Worst Purchase I Have Ever Made...
Reviews.Author: Chester M. Mcateer
Reviews.Content: I have to say that while I was excited to receive my Chromebook, once I started using it I found that it was the worst decision I have ever made with an electronic purchase. It is slow, clunky and makes me feel like I went back 20 years. If I had it to do over again, I wouldn't have made the purchase. In fact, I have it up for sale.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook DOA
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Opened the box and took out my new Chromebook today. Like the product thinness and the sleek look. Huge touchpad. Tiny power supply so easy to carry if you need it. Unfortunately, my experience stopped there. I turned it on and got a screen with an unhappy face that said: "Chrome OS is misssing or damaged. Please connect a recovery device."Checked the box, no recovery device there.Will call tech support and see what they say. If no-joy, Amazon will be getting a return.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: Zalmen Labin "Zalmen"
Reviews.Content: Extremely expensive for virtually a web browser. Its not ready for prime time yet. I wouldn't recommend this unless you need a web browser and you have extra money to waste on the new gadget.

Reviews.Title: you must be kidding
Reviews.Author: SteveTeicher
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get my Samsungh 550, but after attempting to use it for a few hours I suggest that apple and Microsoft have little to fear from Google. It is a horrible product.zi got iy tunning, but thst is about all.  Compared to a mac, an ipad, or a Windows machine it s useless.Steve Teicher.Samsung Series 5 550 Chromebook (Wi-Fi)

Reviews.Title: Returned it for refund
Reviews.Author: Bette Inman "White Crow"
Reviews.Content: The reason it doesn't need an anti-virus program is that it is Linux based.  It is totally user UN-friendly and not intuitive.  It may be good hardware but it is lousy software.  I returned it within a week as not worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: spoiled by Apple; cheap box for $500
Reviews.Author: Ed FitzGerald
Reviews.Content: I am a Google Head. Brought Google Apps for Ed to my school in Fall of 2006. But after using Apple devices, I'm having a hard time liking Samsung's idea of a Chromebook.For one, I was expecting a sub-$400 price for these - after all there's no MS WIndows driving up the price. I've bought  a number of Netbooks over the years and felt they were starting to be a nice device - so I had high hopes for this.But it feels heavier than I expected, there's no keyboard back-light, and the body, especially around the screen hinge is cheap snap-to plastic. But the thing that really rags me the most is the trackpad - I can't tap it to click, I have to press down and click it. Even my $275 Acer netbooks had tap to click.And I can't imagine this holding up for 3 years with a junior high student.And Chrome OS is Chrome - there's not much more to it (file explorer). So $500 to run only Chrome...Update: I was wrong on the tapping the tackpad - for some reason the setting was off by default (weird that when I received the Samsung WiFi only Chromebook it was on by default)Just got Acer Chroembook today. Feels more solid. Screen is smaller/shorter (766px vs 800px vertical) but Samsung is not worth $79 more when buying 20 for a class of kids.

Reviews.Title: Amazon sent a refurbished computer
Reviews.Author: AZflyer
Reviews.Content: I am a Google fanatic and finally pulled the trigger on the Chromebook. I ordered a NEW unit and received a refurbished computer without the operating system loaded. Amazon customer service was very helpful and is re-sending a new unit. It sounded like they have this happen quite often with the Chromebook. I gave three stars only because Amazon dropped the ball, I will update my review when I receive the next computer.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Eliza
Reviews.Content: It is a terrible, slow, the most expensive browser you can ever buy. You can't do nothing on it but check your email, do basic work.Emailing photos takes forever, with uploading, downloading, opening external files,attaching etc. If you have gmail account you can do everything what this machine offers on a regular desktop or laptop plus whatever regular computer has to offer (apps, etc.). So basically on regular desktop/laptop you can do it all, and on Chrom only browsing, docs and that's pretty much it. This is the worst purchase I have made in years. Costly and useless.

Reviews.Title: deteriorates over time until 6 mo later it fails entirely
Reviews.Author: franciscodanconia "franciscodanconia"
Reviews.Content: I own a Samsung Flatscreen, a Samsung Galaxy Nexus phones, and this Chromebook, and not ONE of their products has lasted longer than a few months.The TV's speakers are busted, and I still can't figure out when it's on or off. I hated this samsung tv so much, I replaced it with the Sony Google TV and have been very happy with Sony's sound quality, longevity, and ease of use (I know when it's on or off).The Samsung phone has a curved screen that broke when I was lying on the floor with the phone in my pocket.  this resulted in a very small crack; however, the REAL problem with the phone is the battery life and the annoying software associated with the battery.  I can't STAND this phone.  And in the tradition of Samsung, I can never figure out how to turn ON my phone.  Seems like a simple concept eh?  Not for Samsung.I'm stuck with this POS phone for another 18 months, and I'll never buy samsung again after that, and I probably won't last even that long.  I can't WAIT to get rid of this junker.Lastly, this chromebook worked great initially, altho it was not at all better in any way than the black Chromebook I got off ebay which was pre-production.  Then as I started using it, the performance got slower and slower.  Finally last week, after owning it from Nov 2011, it stopped turning on entirely, it's totally busted.  I have 18 months of "free" internet on it, that I now can't use.SAMSUNG makes the worst electronics known to man, if you buy it, you DESERVE to have to replace it in less than a year.This does not happen with RIMM or Apple products, they last a lifetime.  I'm still using my original iPhone even after dropping it 100 times on concrete.Samsung builds cheap imitation crud.  buy at your own risk.  I'm a VERY experienced owner of electronics, and I appreciate posts which occur well after the product is bought by a reviewer, so here's your chance to get a heads up from someone that's owned it awhile.

Reviews.Title: Trash, simple trash
Reviews.Author: J Matthew Sernell
Reviews.Content: This machine is trash.Google Chrome is actually pretty good as far as an operating system.  Works great with the google apps, web pages are nice.  The google part is just fantastic.The problem is the Samsung part.  The machine is a huge failure.  Trackpad isn't good at all.  Doesn't pick clicks up correctly, doesn't move correctly, just a bad experience.  The machine itself is pretty cheap.  Lid is weak, I don't see it lasting 6 months.  The ports are hidden under doors to give it that great Macbook Air look, but the doors are cheap and I don't think they'll last long either.Samsung may very well be the death of Google Chrome.  It's a great OS, but stuck on hardware like this, it's going to be a hard road to travel.Do not spend your money on this.  I hope the Acer unit is better off, but this machine is a hardware failure on all levels.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Chromebook brand new and its turned out to be a piece of junk. The screen randomly will cut in and out. Only way to get it working is to keep opening and closing it. Its junk and can hardly perform its only task, web browsing. Not worth my time I would rather take a shotgun to it then talk to Samsung about it.

Reviews.Title: Waste of time and money
Reviews.Author: S. Luce
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing in this product that can't be had for less from a laptop or netbook running the Chrome browser. In fact, a real laptop is likely to include a faster processor, larger hard drive, and offline usability for about $100 cheaper. If the only things you care about are Gmail and Facebook, then have at it. Otherwise, your phone is likely more powerful than this piece of garbage.

Reviews.Title: What a Mistake...
Reviews.Author: Mike Kelly "Button Geek"
Reviews.Content: Arrived this afternoon at 3pm. I've spent the last 2 hours trying to get it attached to my WI-FI network that already successfully supports wireless laptops, cell phone, Motorola zoom and my daughter-in-laws Ipod. Guess what, even Samsung couldn't get it to work. Save your money and buy a laptop or a tablet, but stay away from the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Fafnir
Reviews.Content: The computer does not have a windows based operating system so I could not use it for my applications.The item was returned.
